place.name: BRADDEN
place.gazetteerText: BRADDEN, a parish in Towcester district, Northampton; on the river Tove, 3 miles W of Towcester r. station, and 7 SW by W of Blisworth. Post Town, Towcester. Acres, 1,000. Real property, £1,560. Pop., 140. Houses, 39. The property is divided among a few. Bradden House is the seat of the Rev.Ives. The parish is a resort of Sportsmen. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £227.* Patron, the Rev.Ives. The church was Rebuilt in 1859. Bishop Van Mildert was for some time rector. Charities, £55. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
